text: Cytokines and chemokines are important in immune cell recruitment and in regulation of inflammatory responses [ 1 ] .

T-cells produce a broad range of inflammatory mediators , including <extra_id_0> IL-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , <extra_id_0> IL-6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , TNF and <extra_id_0> CXCL8 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , all of which are important in cell proliferation , differentiation , communication and initiation of inflammatory responses [ 2 ] .

text: Elevated levels of pro-inflammatory cytokines and chemokines , such as TNF , <extra_id_0> IL-6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> CXCL8 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , are associated with several human diseases including cystic fibrosis [ 3-5 ] , pulmonary fibrosis [ 6 , 7 ] and AIDS [ 8 , 9 ] .

Induction of <extra_id_0> CXCL8 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> has been suggested to be mediated through NF-kappaB in cooperation with AP-1 [ 10 , 11 ] , however the precise mechanism is not fully elucidated , and treatment strategies aimed at inhibiting <extra_id_0> CXCL8 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> have failed [ 12 ] .

text: Persistent production of <extra_id_0> IL-6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> CXCL8 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> leads to chronic inflammation and enhanced survival of lymphocytes increasing serum cytokine / chemokine levels .

text: This forms the basis of several autoimmune disorders including plasmacytosis and hyperplasia [ 13 ] .

To develop viable <extra_id_0> CXCL8 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> based treatment strategies , it is necessary to identify the signalling pathways regulating <extra_id_0> CXCL8 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and determine how this is coupled to NF-kappaB , AP-1 and <extra_id_0> IL-6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .
The signalling pathways leading to NF-kappaB and AP-1 activation are overlapping , where both are involved in the induction and regulation of cytokines / chemokines .

NF-kappaB is activated in response to stress , such as oxidative stress , bacterial toxins , viruses and UV light [ 14 ] , and is essential for differentiation , proliferation and survival of many cell types including T-lymphocytes [ 15 ] .

AP-1 activation requires Fos ( <extra_id_0> c-Fos <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , <extra_id_0> FosB <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , <extra_id_0> Fra-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , <extra_id_0> Fra-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) and Jun ( <extra_id_0> c-Jun <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , <extra_id_0> v-Jun <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , <extra_id_0> JunB <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , <extra_id_0> JunD <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) through the formation of homo- and hetero-dimers [ 16 , 17 ] , and regulates transcription of a broad range of genes involved in immune responses [ 18-21 ] .

text: Both AP-1 and NF-kappaB binding sites have been identified in the promoter region of <extra_id_0> IL-6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> CXCL8 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> [ 12 , 22 ] , however , the mechanism by which these interleukins are regulated in T-cells is still not clear .

text: <extra_id_0> CXCL8 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> is a C-X-C chemokine with properties enabling it to recruit T-cells and basophils and to activate neutrophils and monocytes [ 23 ] .

<extra_id_0> IL-6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> is a cytokine that possesses both pro - and anti-inflammatory characteristics and that plays a key role in haematopoiesis and acute-phase responses [ 24 , 25 ] .
The present study suggests that the regulation of <extra_id_0> CXCL8 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> IL-6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> is uncoupled .

text: These results indicate that inhibition of NF-kappaB is not an effective strategy in countering the high <extra_id_0> CXCL8 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> activities in diseases such as cystic fibrosis , AIDS and pulmonary fibrosis .
